guide.introduction: I visited Hackett at the Madagascar Institute here in Brooklyn, NY where he helped me weld legs and a base together. You can take a class at your local metal shop or watch Make: Live episode 14.
guide.introduction_rendered: I visited Hackett at the Madagascar Institute here in Brooklyn, NY where he helped me weld legs and a base together. You can take a class at your local metal shop or watch Make: Live episode 14.

lines.text: Take a class at your local metal shop or watch Make: Live episode 14 to learn the basics of welding to create a table base and legs.
lines.text_raw: Take a class at your local metal shop or watch Make: Live episode 14 to learn the basics of welding to create a table base and legs.

lines.text: Or you can bypass welding altogether, and attach hairpin legs with screws.
lines.text_raw: Or you can bypass welding altogether, and attach hairpin legs with screws.

lines.text: Take your typecase or tabletop to your local glass store, or cut the glass yourself, using gloves and protective eye wear.
lines.text_raw: Take your typecase or tabletop to your local glass store, or cut the glass yourself, using gloves and protective eye wear.

lines.text: Wipe your newly welded legs and base down with some rubbing alcohol to clean it. Paint over it with Liquin to give it a lasting finish.
lines.text_raw: Wipe your newly welded legs and base down with some rubbing alcohol to clean it. Paint over it with Liquin to give it a lasting finish.

lines.text: Attach felt pads to the bottom of the table legs to avoid scratching the floor.
lines.text_raw: Attach felt pads to the bottom of the table legs to avoid scratching the floor.

lines.text: Attach the tabletop to the legs with rivets or Liquid Nails. If you use Liquid Nails, clamp the table and legs together for several hours after applying.
lines.text_raw: Attach the tabletop to the legs with rivets or Liquid Nails. If you use Liquid Nails, clamp the table and legs together for several hours after applying.

lines.text: Fill your typecase with trinkets that you can change as often as you want. Add rubber pads to each corner, then place the glass on top.
lines.text_raw: Fill your typecase with trinkets that you can change as often as you want. Add rubber pads to each corner, then place the glass on top.

guide.summary: Learn how to take a vintage typecase and make it into an industrial coffee table.
guide.title: Make a Typecase into a Coffee Table
